physical_appearance: "The image shows a newspaper clipping. The left side of the newspaper looks to have been torn, leaving only the headlines and its body of text. All of the words are written in Tamil. Directly below the headline, ""Tamil Murasu The Leading Tamil Daily in Malaya"" is stated"
sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village, near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu, S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying, handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957, he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai, Govindasamy Sarangapany, Pakkirisami Pillai, and had friendly associations with them.
title_text: The kidnapping of Mr. Appavoo Kandiar by three people A set of five newspaper clippings reporting the kidnapping of Mr.Appavoo Kandiar
subject_terms_2: Newspapers Ransom Contractors Kidnapping victims Millionaires Clippings (Books, newspapers, etc.)
